ie.gmit.sw.language_distribution

Class HashedLangDist

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.sw.language_distribution.LangDist
      • ie.gmit.sw.language_distribution.HashedLangDist

  • public class HashedLangDist
extends LangDist
    Hashed language distribution; a language distribution where each k-mer is hashed into an array (there WILL be collisions, but since other language distributions of the same language would have the same collisions and so record frequencies for the same index, it should still work OK and be much more efficient than using Maps).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HashedLangDist(Lang lang, int hashRange)
      Creates a new hashed language distribution

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double[] getFrequencies()
      Generates a double array of frequency values for this distribution, where each double represents a frequency value between 0 and 1, where 0 means no occurances and 1 means all k-mers were at this index.
      void recordKmer(char[] kmer)
      Records a single k-mer to this language distribution, by hashing the k-mer in order to record it into an array instead of a map.

      • Methods inherited from class ie.gmit.sw.language_distribution.LangDist

        getLang, getNumRecords, recordSample

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • recordKmer

        public void recordKmer(char[] kmer)
        Records a single k-mer to this language distribution, by hashing the k-mer in order to record it into an array instead of a map.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • getFrequencies

        public double[] getFrequencies()
        Generates a double array of frequency values for this distribution, where each double represents a frequency value between 0 and 1, where 0 means no occurances and 1 means all k-mers were at this index.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
